item.description:
In September and October we will discuss "The Way of the Bodhisattva" by Shantideva.  Shantideva was a scholar in the eighth century from the monastic university Nalanda, one of the most celebrated centers of learning in ancient India. According to legend, Shantideva was greatly inspired by the celestial bodhisattva Manjushri, from whom he received teachings and great insights. Treasured by Buddhists of all traditions, "The Way of the Bodhisattva" is a guide to cultivating the mind of enlightenment and to generating the qualities of love, compassion, generosity and patience. Presented in the form of a personal meditation in verse, it outlines the path of the Bodhisattva -- those who renounce the peace of individual enlightenment and vow to work for the libration of all beings and to attain buddhahood for their sake.

The recommended version for our discussion purposes is "The Way of the Boddhisattva" by Shantideva, translated by the Padmakara Translation Group, published by Shambhala Library. This includes a foreword by the Dalai Lama, and helpful notes. The book is available in both hardcover (in a "prayer book" format) and paperback. For the paperback edition: http://www.shambhala.com/html/catalog/items/isbn/978-1-59030-388-7.cfm

This teaching is also available in many other versions. It can also be read online at: http://www.shantideva.net/
